data.name: Juniper Family Campground
data.description: Three (3) loops, 52 site campground near the entrance to the monument. Two (2) sites for small groups up to 20 people. Abert's Squirrel Loop is first come, first serve only. Black Bear and Coyote Loops are available through reservation only. They can be reserved online at Recreation.gov.
data.audioDescription: Juniper Family Campground is located on the mesa above Frijoles Canyon, where the main archaeological sites are found. There are 3 loops in the campground named for local wildlife: Abert's Squirrel Loop, Black Bear Loop, and Coyote Loop. The campground is located in the pinyon-juniper woodland which means there is minimal shade as both of these types of trees are short. An occasional Ponderosa pine towers above the other vegetation providing some shade especially in the Coyote Loop of the campground. The campground is paved and each campground space includes a picnic table and in-ground grill. Each loop also has a restroom facility with a paved walkway leading to it. There are no hookups or showers in the campground but there is a dump station located just adjacent to it.
data.reservationInfo: Only group sites are reservable. all other sites on first come first served basis
data.regulationsOverview: -Generators may be used only from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM. -Clean up your campsite before leaving. Food and trash left behind attracts wildlife. -Picnickers may use campsites for day use but must leave by 4:00 PM. -Pets must be kept on a leash at all times and are not allowed on any park trails. -Quiet hours are from 10:00 PM to 6:00 AM. -Firewood collecting is not permitted within the park. -There is a limit of 2 tents, 2 vehicles, and 10 people per site. -Check-out time is 11:30 AM.

fees.description: Per night, per campsite, up to two (2) vehicles
fees.title: Per site, two (2) cars

data.directionsOverview: From White Rock, New Mexico head west on NM 4 for 10 miles. Turn into park entrance and proceed past entrance station. Campground is accessed by the first road on the right.

operatingHours.description: Self serve campground open 24 hours for individuals and small groups.  No reservations.  First come, first serve.
operatingHours.name: Juniper Family Campground

accessibility.wheelchairAccess: 2 campsites, restrooms and amphitheater are fully ADA accessible. Other areas in the campground are paved road, and paved trail accessible.
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Fires in provided fire pit only, gas stoves only.
accessibility.rvInfo: No hook ups. Generators may be used only from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM.
accessibility.adaInfo: There are 2 designated accessible campsites. Others may meet needs as well. Restrooms are fully accessible as well. Stairs and slopes are found in some locations but overall the campground is relatively flat. Pay phones are not available and cell service is very spotty. There are paved trails to the restroom in each loop.

data.name: Ponderosa Group Campground
data.description: Ponderosa group campground is open year round, with water available May - October only. Site is available by reservation only through Recreation.gov.
data.reservationInfo: The 2 sites are available by reservation only
data.regulationsOverview: There are picnic tables, fire grates, and small cooking shelters. Pit toilets are provided but there are no restrooms with running water. Ponderosa Group Campground is for tent camping. Only one vehicle in a group may be an RV. There is a minimum of 10 people per site and a maximum of 50 people. Check-in time is 4:00 PM and check-out time is 11:30 AM the following day. Day-use is from 11:30 AM - 4:00 PM.

fees.description: Fee per night, per campsite, per group
fees.title: Group camping fee

images.title: Ponderosa Group Campground Picnic Shelter
images.altText: an image of an open sided but covered picnic shelter with big green trees all around
images.caption: Ponderosa Group Campground Picnic Shelter

data.weatherOverview: This campground is located at 7600 feet and is usually free of snow from mid-April through mid October. Water is not available during any months with freezing temperatures. Unlike Juniper Family Campground, reservations are required for Ponderosa Group Campground. Demand is high for this campground, which only has two sites.

accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Fires in fir pits only, gas stoves only.
